title: How to Make an Incense Burner from 2 Liter Bottle

steps.headline: Screw cap back onto the bottle, very tightly.
Take pocket knife or scissors and cut a 10"x4" rectangle in the center of the bottle, the longer sides following along the length of the bottle.
if there's any liquid or moisture in the bottle, dry it with a small towel.
Mark a tiny dot with the Sharpie about 1/2" from the edge of the open rectangle.
steps.description: Be sure the dot is centered with the rectangle and it is placed at the bottle end with the cap.

steps.headline: Take the small nail and lighter or match, and heat up the pointed end of the nail for just a couple of seconds.
steps.description: Be careful not to burn yourself, and don't hold the flame there any longer than 4 seconds, or the whole nail will get hot.

steps.headline: Quickly pierce a hole at a 45 degree angle where you placed your dot.
Take the rectangle piece you cut out, and glue it to the bottom of the bottle.
steps.description: Be sure the bottle is sideways and that the piece you're gluing on is directly opposite of the open rectangle end. This way your incense ashes will fall straight into the open hole.

steps.headline: If you would like to paint the incense burner or color with colored Sharpies, please do so now.
steps.description: If you are not coloring/painting, please skip to step 12.

steps.headline: Place incense burner where you desire.
steps.description: Be sure to keep incense burner out of reach of children and pets, and away from flammable materials, as well as drafts.

steps.headline: Grab incense stick of your choice.
Place non-coated end of incense stick in the hole you pierced.
Light tip of coated end of the incense stick.
steps.description: When you see a glowing tip, or "cherry", blow or fan flame out.

steps.headline: Allow incense smoke to fill the room, bringing a pleasant smell to your home.

text: Wash and dry empty 2-liter bottle  Screw cap back onto the bottle, very tightly.  Take pocket knife or scissors and cut a 10"x4" rectangle in the center of the bottle, the longer sides following along the length of the bottle.  if there's any liquid or moisture in the bottle, dry it with a small towel.  Mark a tiny dot with the Sharpie about 1/2" from the edge of the open rectangle. Be sure the dot is centered with the rectangle and it is placed at the bottle end with the cap. Take the small nail and lighter or match, and heat up the pointed end of the nail for just a couple of seconds. Be careful not to burn yourself, and don't hold the flame there any longer than 4 seconds, or the whole nail will get hot. Quickly pierce a hole at a 45 degree angle where you placed your dot.  Take the rectangle piece you cut out, and glue it to the bottom of the bottle. Be sure the bottle is sideways and that the piece you're gluing on is directly opposite of the open rectangle end. This way your incense ashes will fall straight into the open hole. Allow glue to dry.  If you would like to paint the incense burner or color with colored Sharpies, please do so now. If you are not coloring/painting, please skip to step 12. Allow paint/ink to dry.  Place incense burner where you desire. Be sure to keep incense burner out of reach of children and pets, and away from flammable materials, as well as drafts. Grab incense stick of your choice.  Place non-coated end of incense stick in the hole you pierced.  Light tip of coated end of the incense stick. When you see a glowing tip, or "cherry", blow or fan flame out. Allow incense smoke to fill the room, bringing a pleasant smell to your home.
